activities: Shearman & Sterling LLP (the "Firm") is an international law firm, with offices in EU countries. It utilizes personal information for business development purposes, to provide legal services to clients, and to manage its own human resources functions.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: All personal data processed by the Firm.
recoursemech: Pursuant to the Firm's privacy policy, an internal alternative dispute resolution panel is convened.  In addition, the data subject is expressly entitled to seek relief through mediation, arbitration or the courts of the country, state or political sub-division in which he or she is employed, or in the State of New York.  EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs), Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner of Switzerland (FDPIC)
